description: From Ancient Greek νήματος (nḗmatos), genitive of νῆμα (nêma, “thread”).

adjectives.description: nematic (comparative more nematic, superlative most nematic)

entries.meaning: (physics, chemistry, of certain liquid crystals) Whose molecules align in loose parallel lines.
A liquid crystal whose molecules align in loose parallel lines.
examples: It is easy to see, however, that the same coefficients in nematics determine the adiabatic deformations also.
